00.title: miami galaxy
description: • About this track: This was a fun piece to write; it uses YM2151 (FM), Wonderswan (wavetable) and RF5C68 (PCM), a combination that would otherwise not be possible without the Swiss army knife that is Furnace. I was particularly inspired by late 80s/early 90s Sega arcade game music, such as OutRunners and Thunder Blade, but I decided to get more experimental particularly later in the track. In short, it really is digital fusion. I hope you enjoy it!

01.title: Fomalhaut
description: • About this track: Fomalhaut is the brightest star in the southern constellation of Piscis Austrinus, the Southern Fish, and one of the brightest stars in the night sky. I composed the music with the image of that star in mind.

03.title: Ascension of STARMOG
description: • Programmed, Produced & Mixed by Hal Binderman

• About this track: My first major piece for MSX hardware. My cat Moggie was ill while I wrote most of it, and I finished it the day he passed away. So, while it is mainly a tribute to MSX, it is also a farewell to Moggie.

04.title: Lychee Palace
description: • About this track: The first 30 seconds of this track are nearly unmodified from an old experiment when I first dipped my toes into composing for the NES sound chip. Working under the constraints of only having 3 tonal channels was quite fun, but for a more complete musical concept, I needed to add on the VRC6 expansion chip for the rest of this track.

05.title: quicksilver
description: • About this track: I'm not a very experienced chiptune musician, but I'm super proud of what I made here. I decided to participate in this album on a whim, figuring it could be a good chance to improve at chiptune, and it really went a long way in helping me better grasp how to approach the genre. Between the jazzy melodies and structural fluidity, I'd like to think I did quite well.

06.title: Citrus Cirrus
description: • Programmed, Produced, Mixed & Mastered by Muscises, Gali
• About this track: The whole idea behind the track is that it should evoke a sense of freedom and elevation, almost as if you can touch the clouds.

08.title: Square Concerto in E Minor
description: • Programmed, Produced & Mixed by Nokutoka Momiji
• About this track: Wanted to make something unusual and write a Bach-styled baroque concerto in a chiptune format. Something modern yet old at the same time.

09.title: Just a Little Bit
description: • Mastering Engineer: TBD [scythe or Laz (Lazer Burn Audio)]
• About this track: "Soon I will see you for the first time in a long time!"

10.title: Keep Pushing
description: • Programmed, Produced, Mixed & Mastered by Tobikomi
• About this track: Inspired by PC-88/PC-98 music. This track uses the SEGA Hang-On sound hardware (YM2203 OPN + SegaPCM)

11.title: Chipfunk Invasion
description: • Used VSTs & Samples: Magical 8bit Plug 2, Samplescience "Famidrums"
チップチューンの要素を含む曲は、これまでに何曲か作ったことはあるのですが、チップチューンのルールに完全に従って作ったのは今回が初めてです！最初のバージョンはドラムだけチップチューンでは無かったのですが、アドバイスをもらって完全な曲になりました。しかし、これは大変な作業ですね……。先人の知恵と工夫に対して、改めて最大限の敬意を送ります。そして、頑張って作ったので何回も聞いてくれ！

I've made a few songs containing chiptune elements until now, but this is the first time I've made a track while completely respecting hardware limitations! The first version had non-chiptune drums, but thanks to some advice that I was given, I could perfect the track. I'll admit, it was pretty hard... I have the utmost respect for the ingenuity and the intelligence of my predecessors. I did my best for this track, so I hope you'll listen to it again and again!
